subject: AI & Agents
title: Shakey the Robot
description: A short lesson to help you apply Shakey the Robot.

hook.text: In 1966, a wobbly robot at Stanford became the first machine to reason about its own actions.

buildup.text: Shakey combined vision, movement planning, and logical reasoning in one system.

discovery.text: It could navigate rooms, push boxes, and follow instructions like 'move the block to the table.'

twist.text: Shakey moved at two meters per hour. Each action required minutes of computation.

climax.text: But the algorithms it pioneered â€” A* search and STRIPS planning â€” are still used today.

punchline.text: Slow and shaky, but the ideas were rock solid.

quiz.question: What was Shakey the Robot known for?
options: First robot to reason about its own actions
First robot to pass the Turing Test
